intro: Thlaspi huetii, commonly known as the Huet's cress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape, with a hairy surface. Its flowers are small, white, and arranged in racemes, typical of the mustard family. Thlaspi huetii is often found in mountainous regions of Europe and is adapted to harsh, cold climates.
